Mode.name: FPA
Mode.Description: Flight Path Angle (FPA) mode allows the pilot to command a specific climb or descent angle in degrees. The aircraft maintains the selected angle relative to the horizon.
Mode.Activation: Activated by pulling the Flight Path Angle selector knob. Requires a valid angle input such as +3.0 degrees or -2.5 degrees.
Mode.Behavior: The aircraft maintains the selected pitch angle. Vertical speed varies depending on airspeed and atmospheric conditions. When approaching the selected altitude, the system transitions to ALT* for altitude capture.
